data.title: Micro Brewery and good food all in one
data.text: Stopped here with a tour group and was very happy we did.  Had a substainal meal of salad with lots of spaghetti and sauce.  The beers that makes this a brewery are all listed on the wall and so I like dark beer and had to try theirs.  Not bad but not Leinies Creamy Dark either.  Nice atmosphere for a pub and micro brewery in a good location.

data.title: Great Artisan Pizza
data.text: This is our go-to place for specialty pizzas. The craft beer is good and we love the selection of pizzas as well as other options.

data.title: Great food and atmosphere
data.text: Had the New York strip.  One of the best I have had. Chips and beer cheese are great and had fried pickles. Service was prompt and came with lots of smiles. Highly recommend this place.

data.title: Good Pizza and Beer
data.text: We read about the Black Horse Pub on trip advisor while driving from Nashville to St Louis. It's located in Clarksville but really not all that close to I-24 and the detour and traffic put us about one hour out of our way. The service was great and the restaurant was nearly empty at 1:30 PM. We ordered the cheese dip which did not live up to  its reputation, but the New York style pizza, was fresh and tasty. The pub has a fine selection of local craft draft beers.

data.title: Great service!
data.text: On the way home from our fall road trip, we decided at the last minute to stop in Clarksville, Tennessee for dinner.  We looked up restaurants on Trip Advisor, and after reading some reviews, decided to stop at the Black Horse in the historic downtown area.  What made our stop there the most fun was our server, Annaleigh.  She greeted us right when we sat down and was very patient in answering our many questions...about the different beers, different options on the menu, etc.  She was also very personable.  As we were waiting for our food, she came back to check on us and we got into a conversation about the beautiful old bar and the area around the pub.  We ordered a beer flight (the Wicked Harvest was excellent), each of us had a house salad and we split a philly flatbread.  The great service and excellent food made this a wonderful place to stop.

data.title: Pizza
data.text: Stopped here based on Tripadvisor ratings.Had dinner here on a Saturday night.  When we walked in a noticed that a lot of people had pizzas.  We had the Blackhorse combo with garlic crust.  The pizza is very good.  Our waitress was perfect.  We had fried green tomatoes with pimento cheese and tomato jam for an appetizer.  It didn't sound great to me but turned out to be the best fried green tomatoes I've ever had.  One in our party had the pork chops and said it was the best pork chops he had ever eaten.  Would definitely eat here again.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Good basic food with nice pleasant service. My husband had a individual pizza and it was excellent... so good he wouldn't even share with me😁

data.title: Best Vanilla beer in town
data.text:
We used to live in Clarksville, it is our favorite go to!!!!!!
Nice ambience, great food, wonderful beer!

data.title: APSU Homecoming
data.text: Service was fast and friendly! For a very busy Saturday night you might expect things to be a little slower but not here. The beer cheese dip with soft pretzels were a great appetizer. Topped that off with the Heart Attack  pizza. Glad we tried this. Our server constantly checked on us and kept our drinks filled.

data.title: Lunch
data.text:
I met a friend here for an early lunch at 11am on a weekday. I recommend arriving early because by 12 noon it was hopping and people were waiting for tables. 

I introduced her to the Beer Cheese Dip. I've been a long time fan! She loved it! 

I had the Burger with Pimento Jelly and a Fried Green Tomato. I've had it before and it was amazing! My friend had the Reuben and a Greek Salad. She loved them both! 

Great location downtown Clarksville. Wonderful to take guests or dine because it's Local and not a Chain Restaurant.

data.title: The best place to eat in town
data.text: Nothing on the menu is bad it's all good. I like to start with the artichoke dip as I wait for my pizza. Best pizza in town might i add. I am looking forward to chili season because this is where it's the best!

data.title: Good beer, food and atmosphere.
data.text: The food and beer here great, but the lower level was extremely loud and took away from the experience. We'll definitely go back again, hoping it wont be so loud.

data.title: Eat here!
data.text: We love it here! We are new to the area (as of April 2016) and we eat here legit once a week. Everything is good. We love the beer and pizza! The mahi is my favorite and my husband likes the inferno flatbread. We also always order the fried green tomatoes and the cookie dessert.

data.title: Always good
data.text:
I've been here several times. My family has never had a bad experience. They do get busy at times, but it's convenient for us so it's worth the wait. 
I've brought friends and family here on several occasions and everyone has enjoyed their meal. My kids ask to eat hear a lot as well.

data.title: Great beer and good pizza
data.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this location,   it was recommended to my colleagues and I by a local and we decided to try it out. Upon arrival I was a little dubious that the food would be good because it looks like it is just a bar. I ordered a bomber of beer and it was very good. The spinach dip was also very good. What really stood out was the pizza, it had plenty of toppings, good sauce, and great crust, the crust was hit the right thickness and it was cooked perfectly. I also had an IPA which paired well with the pizza and was well balanced.

data.title: good food, so-so beer
data.text:
I had one of the flatbread pizzas and it was very good. I got a flight of all their current beers and all were so-so.

There were also some extremely loud children nearby...I get that it's a restaurant but it's a bar too. Seems like there would be a more appropriate please to have lunch with kids.

data.title: Locally brewed beer and dark wood pub atmosphere
data.text:
Blackhorse Brewery makes a eight artesian beers, from a light vanilla to a dark stout.  They offer a sampler of their wares (not free samples).  This is a nice way for someone wanting to learn about beer to  get the experience without getting blotto.  The beer cheese dip is very good.

Black Horse also makes it's own pizza dough and their pizzas are a great fit with the beer.  The have several specials, or you can create your own master-pizza.  The menu is rounded out with burgers, sandwiches, steaks an and the rest, all tasty and served by a friendly staff.  

This is a sports pub, so there are the mandatory flat screens in in the bar area, but there is also a dining area, though this isn't a place I would go to for quiet conversation on a game night.

Expect to wait during peak times, but it's worth it.  Dinner for two with an appetizer and beer will run about $40.00.

data.title: Worth the wait
data.text: We went to the Black Horse our first night in Clarksville. When we arrived there were lines out the door so we took our pager and went exploring. Across the street is an amazing shop where the owners repurpose items and make amazing art...however when we got in the pub I ordered fried green tomatoes which were incredible and then I had an absolutely terrific burger. I loved it.

data.title: A real brew pub.sports bar....not a lame immitation.
data.text: The burgers were very good...fantastic fries.  Great servers. We saw everything from bikers to business people...all good.  Leave the babies at home.  Waitresses were best anywhere.

data.title: Great food
data.text: Extremely friendly staff. Clean environment with good food selection. Fast service and restrooms clean
